answerText: "The Lady of Shallott"[10] This English poet wrote "The Lady of Shallott" as well as "Crossing the Bar" and "The Charge of the Light Brigade." He was the longest serving Poet Laureate of England.
heading: MUT |2012 | 2 | 21 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The title woman of this work lives in a tower that overlooks "a space of flowers" on a "silent isle" in a river that is banked by "long fields of barley and of rye." For 10 points each: [10] Name this poem about a woman who "weaves by night and day" until she sees Sir Lancelot out her window.
